Configure a Cell Statistics Profile

Use this task to create a statistics monitoring profile necessary for configuring a cell.

  1. In the navigation bar, click Profiles > Summary.
  2. In the Profiles window, click the System Profiles tab.
  3. Click +Create.
  4. In the Create System Profile window, enter the name of this profile in the Profile Name field.
  5. Select StatsInterval from the Profile Type drop-down list and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    Name field Specify the cell name.
    LTE Sampling Frequency

    (Optional) Specify the number of minutes from 0 to 60 for reporting the granularity of the eNodeB LTE counters that the PW EMS receives. The default value is 15 minutes.
    Resources Sampling Frequency (Optional) Specify the number of minutes from 0 to 60 for reporting the granularity of the eNodeB hardware resource counters that the PW EMS receives. The default value is 15 minutes.
    Network Sampling Frequency The default periodic network sampling is once every 15 minutes. Enter a time period from 0 to 60 minutes for the PW EMS to sample cell network statistics.
    UMTS Sampling Frequency (Optional) Specify the number of minutes from 0 to 60 for reporting the granularity of the eNodeB Universal Mobile Telecommunications Service (UMTS) counters that the PW EMS receives. The default value is 15 minutes.
    GSM Sampling Frequency (Optional) Specify the number of minutes from 0 to 60 for reporting the granularity of the eNodeB Global System for Mobile Communication (GSM) counters that the PW EMS receives. The default value is 15 minutes.
  6. Click Create+.
Parent topic: Configure Device System Profiles
